item.title: Options for inputting forecasts in the Nifty Nifty forecaster
item.description:
I’m in Denver this week for client training sessions and our company’s annual year-end event, which is happening on Friday. Let me quickly share a cool feature in Forecaster called “input by all segments.” Imagine your Forecaster system uses segments like DEPT (3 characters) and MAIN (4 characters). DEPT is assignable, while MAIN is reversible. Typically, users go to Data»Input, choose an Input Set, and specify a DEPT. This brings up a multi-row input screen with MAIN accounts as rows and periods as columns...

item.title: Sections and Accounts for Forecasting
item.description:
Forecaster uses Lines (or Line Sets) to define which accounts appear in input sets or reports. You can assign these lines to specific cost centers, creating an “override” that tailors the accounts displayed for a particular department’s input set. For example, the Accounting department would only see accounts relevant to their work. We’ve already covered these Forecaster navigation paths: Build»Lines Build»Reports or Report Worksheet Setup»Budgets»Input Set»Overrides You can also create Sections (Setup»Budgets»Sections) to organize your lines in input sets or reports with headers, improving data presentation...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/sections-and-accounts-for-forecasting/

item.title: Forecaster TRANSLATE -versus- TRANSLATEL
item.description:
Understanding the distinction between the TRANSLATE and TRANSLATEL tasks in Forecaster is crucial for effective currency translation. While Forecaster generally operates on a straightforward currency conversion principle, utilizing an “originating” currency for input and mapping it to a “functional” currency for output, these tasks offer nuanced control. Even when auto-translate is active, situations may arise where manual intervention is needed. The key difference lies in the scope of translation. TRANSLATE comprehensively converts all departments or assignable segments from the “originating” to the “functional” currency...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/forecaster-translate-versus-translatel/

item.title: Who is it, what is it, forecaster?
item.description:
To help new Forecaster users understand its intricacies, let’s break down the relationships between Forecaster, its users, data sources, and FRx. The Forecaster database, created after installation using the Forecaster Database Creation Wizard, stores all the relevant data. During creation, a database owner is assigned, who can then manage periods within the Forecaster application itself. Users can interact with Forecaster through either the web interface or the client application. While both offer data access, input, and reporting functionalities, the client application provides additional features for administrators...
